name: Highland Reserve

reviews.text: A fantastic place to stay and not too far from all of the parks etc.
reviews.title: Fantastic,loved every minute!!!

reviews.text: We stayed at 1121 Northampton Drive and the villa was amazing,very spacious and well equipped. My children loved the pool too. (Our villa did not be overlook the golf course)
reviews.title: Great Family Getaway

reviews.text: There is a park on the reserve which was a 5 to 10 minute walk away,there was also an outdoor pool and a tennis court next to the park.
reviews.title: Be careful which one you rent

reviews.text: My husband played the Golf course which he thoroughly enjoyed and he said the staff were great too.
reviews.title: Exactly what it said on the box

reviews.text: There is a Publix shop within walking distance and a Walmart 5 minutes drive away. Walmart was a lot cheaper than publix so if your on a budget shop at Walmart.
reviews.title: Tired villa !!!!

reviews.text: Stayed here for two weeks with my husband and our two boys!
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.text: We had a fabulous 4 bed villa and pool all to ourselves which looked right out onto one of the fairways.
reviews.title: excellent villa

reviews.text: Beautifully kept surroundings and the villa had everything we needed and more. Very handy for berry town centre which had takeaways a publix supermarket, gas station, Applebee's and a bank.
reviews.title: Fabulous place to spend a glorious fortnight!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 15mins from Disney about 35mins to universal.
reviews.title: Villa Jasmine 10 Davenport F;orida

reviews.text: We loved it here and wouldn't think twice about returning.
reviews.title: Not what i expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at a villa in Highland Reserve for 2 weeks from 26th June 2011 and loved every moment. Brilliant location for the disney parks, good supermarkers and restaurants nearby and it was good to be out of the way of International Drive. Would definitely recommend this location to anyone, it was immaculate, exceptionally comfortable and we have no complaints whatsoever about our stay.
reviews.title: Great holiday and Villa!!!

reviews.text: We have just booked to return to Highland Reserves for a further 2 weeks from 12th May 2012 and have recommended the location to our friends! We just can't wait to get back!!!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked through Thomas cook so had to pick up keys at different location, greatvlocation, Disney 15 mins,sea world 20 mins and universal 25/30 mins.
reviews.title: "Fantastic Holiday"
Worst Vacation Rental Ever...
reviews.text: Nice and quiet location, was in Troon circle & backed onto golf course so lovely and quiet.
Villa had everything we needed.
reviews.title: Nice homes but lacking attention to detail

reviews.text: We stayed in August 2012 as a family holiday in Highland Reserve. Lovely location overlooking the golf course. the villa, however had a few issues, such as a lack of cooking facilities such as pots and pans and the air conditioning wasn't working properly and then packed in but was fine once repaired. disposal of rubbish was an issue as next door used our dustbin and left a load of rubbish lying causing fly infestation. A games room in the garage was a wonderful idea and kept the lads busy while the girls went shopping. still had a wonderful time.
reviews.title: 6th visit to Florida

reviews.text: We stayed in Highland Reserve in July 2012, with our main aim being to go to Disneyworld for the week, however I could've just stayed in the villa as it was that amazing! Even though there was only 5 of us, it could sleep 8, not counting the sofas available. It was massive, with four bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, a full kitchen with everthing you could need, a utility room with a washer and a dryer, a garage with a pingpong table, a large dining area, a kitchen dining area and an outdoor dining area! Not to mention the pool - it was the best part. The pool was covered by a wire mesh so no insects or animals could get in. There were 4 separate doors out to the pool, one of which led to the master bedroom and another to an ensuite bathroom of another bedroom. The place really was huge!
reviews.title: Perfect Accommodation!

reviews.text: The location was great, but you really do need a car. There is a Publix supermarket that isn't too far down the road, as well as a Target etc.
reviews.title: Location was fab! Very spacious!

reviews.text: Disneyworld itself is about a 20 minute drive and Universal Studios, 30minutes. It was the perfect location as we were away from the Disney hype when we returned to the villa.
reviews.title: Lovely villas

reviews.text: Orlando is so so hot and the air conditioning in the villa was fantastic, as it wasn't too cold when you entered the house.
reviews.title: Highland Reserve

description: The prestigious and well established Highlands Reserve Golf and Country Clubis set in undulating countryside surrounded by orange groves, oaks and pine trees. This highly popular and sought after community features wide tree lined boulevards, pavements, street lighting and green areas. A safe environment for children to play. We feature 3 - 6 bedroom luxury villas all with their own private pools.Facilities available to renting guests include Tennis Courts, 76' (23m) Community Pool, Golf Club House and Golf Course. In addition, the excellent shops, bars and restaurants at Berry Town Centre which is an easy walk away.The development includes a championship 18 hole (par 72) golf course, a large communal swimming pool, a children's play area and a tennis courts. The clubhouse features a pro-shop and serves snacks and drinks.All villas are set on generous plots and are not all "crammed in" as is found on many other developments. Most villas benefit from conservation or golf course views, fully taking advantage of the beautiful setting at Highlands Reserve - you can't but be impressed and you will want to come back year after year !!Highlands Reserve has the zip code 33897 (check it out on Google Earth) and is located just 10 minutes west of Disney World, on Highway US27 just south of US192. It has easy access to Interstate 4 (some 2 miles to the south), which means easy access to all of Florida's main Theme Parks and attractions, including the beautiful beaches of Florida's Gulf and Atlantic coastlines.Orlando International Airport (MCO) is about 35 minutes away, Sanford Airport is about 50 minutes away, Tampa International Airport is about 75 minutes and Miami is 3.5 hours away.The nearest supermarket (Publix) is just a 10 - 25 minute WALK away (depending on where you are staying on Highlands Reserve) north of Highlands Reserve on the US27 which also has strip mall with a huge variety of shops, restaurants, takeaways and bars - alternatively you could drive there in less than 3 minutes.
